name: Curry Rice
history: Curry Rice combines the elements of Indian spices with the staple grain, rice. This dish is popular in various cuisines worldwide, each adding its unique twist to the curry flavor.
description: Curry Rice is a simple yet delicious dish made with rice cooked in a blend of curry spices. It's often accompanied by vegetables or meat and is known for its vibrant color and rich flavor.

instructions.title: Sauté Onions and Garlic
instructions.description: Heat oil in a saucepan over medium heat. Add the chopped onion and garlic, and sauté until they are soft and translucent.

instructions.title: Add Spices
instructions.description: Stir in the curry powder and turmeric, cooking for a minute until fragrant.

instructions.title: Cook the Rice
instructions.description: Add the Basmati rice to the saucepan, stirring to coat the rice in the spices. Pour in the vegetable broth or water, and add salt to taste.

instructions.title: Simmer the Rice
instructions.description: Bring the mixture to a boil, then reduce the heat to low. Cover and simmer for 18-20 minutes, or until the rice is tender and the liquid is absorbed.

instructions.title: Serve
instructions.description: Fluff the rice with a fork and serve hot. This curry rice can be enjoyed on its own or as a base for other dishes.

tips: Adjust the amount of curry powder to suit your taste preferences.
For added nutrition, mix in vegetables like peas or carrots during cooking.
variations: Coconut Curry Rice: Use coconut milk instead of water for a creamy version.
Spicy Curry Rice: Add chopped chilies or red pepper flakes for extra heat.

storage.shelfLife: Can be refrigerated for up to 3 days.
storage.instructions: Store in an airtight container and reheat before serving.

reheatingInstructions: Reheat in a microwave or on the stove with a splash of water to maintain moisture.
presentationTips: Serve in a bowl, garnished with fresh herbs or sliced green onions.
Accompany with a side of yogurt or a simple salad for a balanced meal.
